column4: Hi.  I removed my swap, to re-size it.  I re-created it; it's still /hda5... however, I'm having problems.  WHen ubuntu starts, it doesn't auto-mount.. but if I /sbin/mkswap it, it works.. ANY ideas?? it's listed in my fstab.

Hi guys.  Need some help.  I deleted/re-created my swap file to re-size it.  It's still /dev/hda5... but it doesn't auto-mount on boot.  /sbin/mkswap makes it show up.  It's listed in "fstab".  any ideas?
greg_g;  I don't have UUID's in my fstab..
boot, try to mount /dev/hda5 and see what error it gives
I asked you to do something. please do it
I'm sorry.  You asked me to paste.. er, hold on
yes O lmpw- nit O asled ypi sp,etjomg secofoc
mount: mount point none does not exist
well, swapon -a mounts it now.  but if I reboot, it won't.  Let me reboot and grab the error message for you.
if I /sbin/mkswap, it will "mount" - but I can never get swapon -a to work.
yes. and since it's there I dunno why swapon says that
